prompt: <description>Part 1 Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section. The dimensions of the prism are approximately 2:3:4. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at euler angles [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and translation vector [0.0, 0.75, 0.0]. Now, create the first face of the sketch. * Draw a line from point [0.0, 0.0] to point [0.1125, 0.0]. * Draw a line from point [0.1125, 0.0] to point [0.1125, 0.1875]. * Draw a line from point [0.1125, 0.1875] to point [0.0, 0.1875]. * Draw a line from point [0.0, 0.1875] to point [0.0, 0.0]. Create the second face of the sketch by following these steps: * Draw a line from point [0.009, 0.009] to point [0.1035, 0.009]. * Draw a line from point [0.1035, 0.009] to point [0.1035, 0.1785]. * Draw a line from point [0.1035, 0.1785] to point [0.009, 0.1785]. * Draw a line from point [0.009, 0.1785] to point [0.009, 0.009]. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.1875. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch based on the defined coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with an extrusion depth of 0.75 towards the normal and 0 extrusions towards the opposite direction of the normals, respectively, with a scaling parameter of 0.1875. Part 2 Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at euler angles [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] and translation vector [0.1125, 0.1875, 0.0]. Sketch face 1 as follows: * Draw a line from point [0.0, 0.0] to point [0.5625, 0.0]. * Draw a line from point [0.5625, 0.0] to point [0.5625, 0.015]. * Draw a line from point [0.5625, 0.015] to point [0.0, 0.015]. * Draw a line from point [0.0, 0.015] to point [0.0, 0.0]. Sketch face 2: * Draw a circle with center point [0.436, 0.065] and radius 0.0141. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.5625. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch based on the defined coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with no extrusions towards the normal and 0.15 extrusions towards the opposite direction of the normals, respectively, with a scaling parameter of 0.5625 using a cut operation. Confidence: 95%</description>
